MainHeading.P: Chuaigh an Leas-Cheann Comhairle i gceannas ar 2.30 p.m.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions. Oral Answers. - Election to Seanad Éireann.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Begley Mr. Begley
Speaker.P: asked the Taoiseach if the Government have any proposals to restructure the Seanad; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: The Taoiseach Garret FitzGerald
Speaker.P: I have no such proposals at present.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Begley Mr. Begley
Speaker.P: Does the Taoiseach agree that graduates from Irish universities now domiciled in South Africa and who support apartheid can elect Members to the Houses of the Oireachtas? Will he allow that position to continue? As we have banned their fruit, why not ban their votes?

Speaker.hpid: The Taoiseach Garret FitzGerald
Speaker.P: The electorate for university seats in the Seanad consists of graduates no matter in which country they live. We have never made any distinctions in this regard and the issue has never arisen. I note the Deputy's comments.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Begley Mr. Begley
Speaker.P: Will the Taoiseach still allow graduates who actively support the South African Government in public relations exercises around the world to vote in Seanad elections?

Speaker.hpid: The Taoiseach Garret FitzGerald
Speaker.P: Well, some graduates may be in jail but they still have a right to vote in Seanad elections.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Haughey Mr. Haughey
Speaker.P: Could the Taoiseach, in one of his many capacities, do anything to ensure that university registers for the Seanad elections are updated and made more accurate than they usually are?

Speaker.hpid: The Taoiseach Garret FitzGerald
Speaker.P: I would be very happy if that should be done as effectively as possible as I share the Deputy's awareness of the defects of the system which lead to very inadequate registers because of the problem of establishing addresses and the survival of graduates. The registers are defective and I know that efforts have been made to improve their quality but, by the standards of other registers, because of the way they have to be compiled, they are defective and unsatisfactory in certain respects.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions. Oral Answers. - Commemoration of 1916 Easter Proclamation.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. G. Mitchell Mr. G. Mitchell
Speaker.P: asked the Taoiseach if the Government will consider marking the 70th year since the 1916 Easter Proclamation by a cultural or historic measure or measures, designed to encourage true patriotism based on nonviolence and the common good.

Speaker.hpid: The Taoiseach Garret FitzGerald
Speaker.P: There are no proposals for special commemorative measures this year to mark the 70th anniversary of the 1916 Easter Proclamation. In the past, special commemorative events were organised for the 25th and 50th anniversaries. The annual commemoration will be held in Arbour Hill on 7 May 1986.

Arrangements are also being made, as recommended by an informal Oireachtas all-party committee, for the holding each year of a national day of commemoration to honour all Irishmen and Irishwomen who died in past wars or on service with the United Nations.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions. Oral Answers. - National Day of Commemoration.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Bell Mr. Bell
Speaker.P: asked the Taoiseach the consultations, if any, he has had with the Army regarding National Day of Commemoration 1986, to be held in July; the form the parade will take; and the organisations which will be invited to attend and participate.

Speaker.hpid: The Taoiseach Garret FitzGerald
Speaker.P: I presume that the Deputy is referring to the proposed national day of commemoration.

I refer the Deputy to the reply which I gave to a similar question on 13 November 1985. I am arranging to have the recommendations of the inter-departmental committee discussed with the parties in this house at an early date.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Bell Mr. Bell
Speaker.P: Could I ask the Taoiseach if consideration will be given to the report of the all-party committee in the sense that he will ensure that there is a substantial military presence in relation to the parade?

Speaker.hpid: The Taoiseach Garret FitzGerald
Speaker.P: The form of commemoration will be discussed between the parties. The existing proposals involve the participation of the Army but it is a matter for discussion between the leaders of the parties.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Bell Mr. Bell
Speaker.P: Will the Taoiseach notify the Members of the House when arrangements have been concluded for the parade?

Speaker.hpid: The Taoiseach Garret FitzGerald
Speaker.P: Yes, of course. I have just written to the leaders of the various parties and discussions will be taking place shortly in regard to this matter.

However, in view of the substantial numbers unemployed in the Louth area, with particular reference to north Louth, would the Minister use his good offices in arranging for the same facilities to apply to the level of grants for County Louth as to other Border counties and to investigate this matter?

As there are 50 minutes remaining I intend allowing 25 minutes for questions addressed to the Minister for the Gaeltacht and 25 minutes for questions addressed to the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions. Oral Answers. - Údarás na Gaeltachta Grants.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for the Gaeltacht the number of projects approved for grant-aid by Údarás na Gaeltachta in 1985 which have not yet received grant payment; the percentage decrease by the Department of Finance for grant allocation to Údarás na Gaeltachta in 1986; the number of projects approved so far in 1986; and whether projects approved in 1985 will take up the total announced grant allocation for 1986.

Speaker.hpid: Aire na Gaeltachta (Mr. O'Toole) Aire na Gaeltachta (Mr. O'Toole)
Speaker.P: Tuigim ó Údarás na Gaeltachta go raibh éilimh ann ar 31 Márta 1986 ar íocaíochtaí i leith 119 dtogra a raibh deontais ceadaithe ina leith, gur cheadaigh an bord 70 togra sa thréimhse trí mhí ó 1 Eanáir 1986 go dtí 31 Márta 1986, agus go mbraitheann íocaíochtaí deontas i 1986 ar líon na dtograí a thiocfaidh chun oibríochta i rith na bliana sin. Suim £4.175 mhilliún atá údaraithe mar dheontas-i-gcabhair do chaiteachas caipitil i 1986 i gcomparáid le suim £5.125 mhilliún i 1985.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: Cé mhéid tograí atá ceadaithe ag an Údarás, a cheadaíodh i 1985 agus nach bhfuil aon íocaíocht deontais déanta ina leith go fóill?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. O'Toole Mr. O'Toole
Speaker.P: As an 119 dtogra a dúirt mé a bhí ann, tá sé an-deacair figiúr a fháil den mhéid a bhí ceadaithe roimh dheireadh na bliana seo caite toisc go raibh cuid acu gur tugadh cabhair dóibh cheana. Tá sé an-deacair ag an bpointe seo é sin a dhéanamh ach d'fhéadfainn an t-eolas d'fháil don Teachta. Deirtear liom go mbeadh deacrachtaí faoi leith ag baint le figiúr a thabhairt ag an bpointe seo.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: Is aisteach go dtabharfadh an tAire freagra den tsórt sin nuair atá figiúirí a dtabhairt ag na meán-chumarsáidí le roint seachtainí anuas. Níor fhreagair an tAire an chéad chuid de mo cheist. Níl mé sásta ar chor ar bith leis an bhfreagra atá an tAire ag tabhairt mar chuir mé an cheist san cheist Dhála. Creidim go bhfuil deacracht uafásach ag an Údarás faoi láthair mar an deontas caipitil gur as a n-íoctar deontais chuig comhlachtaí a chuireann postanna ar fáil sa Ghaeltacht, tá laghdú mór ar an méid a fuair siad i mbliana thairis an bhliain seo caite agus teastaíonn uaim a fháil amach cé mhéid de na tograí atá ceadaithe do 1985, go háirithe i ndeireadh 1985, nach bhfuair aon deontas fós agus a thógas suas airgead na bliana seo i dtreo nach mbeidh aon airgead de chuid na bliana seo ar fáil do aon togra a cheadófar i mbliana?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. O'Toole Mr. O'Toole
Speaker.P: Glacaim leis go bhfuil deacrachtaí airgeadais ag an Údarás ó thaobh chaipitil de agus ta an cheist sin á plé agam faoi láthair leis an mbord. Bhí cruinniú agam leo, mar tá a fhios ag an dTeachta. D'fhéadfadh sé tarlú — agus níl anseo ach tuairim — go gcaithfí an t-iomlán ar thograí a cheadaíodh sa bhliain seo caite. Níil an t-eolas sin agam go beacht agus níor mhaith liom dalladh mullóg a chur ar an Teach ach d'fhéadfadh sé tarlú. Braitheann sé ar cén saghas togra atá i gceist agus nuair a bheas léibhéal na ndeontas agus chuile rud eile déanta amach go mb'fhéidir go dtarlódh sé go gcaithfí an t-airgead iomlán ar thograí a cheadaíodh roimh dheireadh na bliana. Mar a deirim tá ceist airgeadais an Údaráis á plé agam faoi láthair agus beidh mé ag dul ar ais ag an mbord agus ag an eagraíocht féin. Tá súil agam amach anseo freagraí a thabhairt agus teacht ar réiteach, más féidir é, ar an gcruachás ina bhfuilid.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: Séard tá á rá ag an Aire ná, as an airgead a chuir an Rialtas seo ar fáil do Údarás na Gaeltachta i mbliana, nach gcruthófar aon phost breise a cheadófar i mbliana dá bharr sin mar go ghfuil seans ann nach mbeidh aon airgead fágtha as airgead na bliana seo i gcomhair tograí na bliana seo. An dtuigeann an tAire cé chomh docharach agus chomh timpisteach agus atá sé sin d'Údarás na Gaeltachta agus an é atá i gceist ag an Aire ná go stopfadh Údarás na Gaeltachta ag feidhmiú nuair a thiocfadh sé go dtí lár na bliana agus go mbeadh sé éasca aige féin an eagraíocht a dhúnadh síos. An é sin atá i gceist ar an Aire — dúnadh síos?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. O'Toole Mr. O'Toole
Speaker.P: Dúirt mé go raibh an seans ann — agus caithfidh mé é á rá arís — go bhféadfadh toscaí áirithe dul i bhfeidhm go gcaithfí an t-airgead ina iomlán. Nílimse ag rá go dtarlóidh sé sin ach d'fhéadfadh sé tarlú agus ní chuile dhuine a dhéarfadh sin ag seasamh ar an dtaobh seo den Teach. Táimse ag rá go bhféadfadh sé tarlú ach níl an t-eolas sin agam. Ní maith liom ach eolas beacht a thabhairt don Teach. Anois, tuigim sin ina iomlán cé hiad na deacrachtaí atá ag cur as don Údarás. Níl sé ar intinn agam — níl a fhios agam cé mhéid uair a chaithfeas mé é seo a rá — an tÚdarás a chur as agus níl mé ag cruthú leithscéal go ndéanfaí é sin agus ná ceapadh an Teachta nó aon Teachta eile sa Teach seo gur b'shin atá ar intinn agam. Mar adeirim, tig leis an Teachta a bheith cinnte go bhfuilimse agus go mbeidh mé ag plé na ceiste seo leis an Údarás agus tá mé cinnte go mbeimid in ann teacht ar réiteach ionnas go mbeidh an tÚdarás ábalta an job atá idir lámha acu a dhéanamh ar an mbealach is fearr do mhuintir na Gaeltachta.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: An bhfuil sé i gceíst ag an Aire meamram a chur os comhair an Rialtais ag lorg breis airgid chaipitil d'Údarás na Gaeltachta i dtreo go mbeidh siad in ann an gnó a dhéanamh lenár cuireadh ar bun iad — postanna a chruthú sa Ghaeltacht i mbliana?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. O'Toole Mr. O'Toole
Speaker.P: Maidir le hairgead breise a chur ar fáil, tig leis an Teachta a bheith cinnte go mbainfear úsáid as na gnábhealaigh sin.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: An n-aontóidh an tAire go bhfuil se deacair ag muintir na Gaeltachta agus ag an Údáras postanna d'fháil agus go bhfuil lag-mhisneach orthu i ngeall air nach bhfuil a fhios acu cen chaoi a bhfuil cúrsaí ag dhul ag tarlú feasta maidir le postanna a chur ar fáil? Níl airgead acu. Tá tograí acu ach níl siad in ann na postanna a chur ar fáil. Níl sé sin sásúil mar ó tharla go bhfuil fostaíocht sna Gaeltachtaí tábhachtach, tá siad i gcaoi anois nach bhfuil a fhios acu céard a dhéanfaidh siad as seo amach. Dá réir sin caithfidh daoine a ghlacadh nach bhfuil an tAire ná an Rialtas sásta lán-tacaíocht a thabhairt don Údarás chun fostaíocht a chur ar fáil.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. O'Toole Mr. O'Toole
Speaker.P: Tá an Rialtas sásta lán-tacaíocht a thabhairt.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Wilson Mr. Wilson
Speaker.P: An bhfuil sé fíor go bhfuil 500 postanna ag brath ar chinneadh an Rialtais anois díreach? An bhfuil sé sin fíor?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. O'Toole Mr. O'Toole
Speaker.P: Níl.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Wilson Mr. Wilson
Speaker.P: Fiú 500 postanna ó 1985 leis na cinn eile i 1986?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. O'Toole Mr. O'Toole
Speaker.P: Níl.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Wilson Mr. Wilson
Speaker.P: Agus an mó postanna atá i gceist mar sin?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. O'Toole Mr. O'Toole
Speaker.P: Bheadh níos mó ná sin ann má chuirtear san áireamh chuile phost atá idir lámha agus a bheas idir lámha ag an Údarás.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Wilson Mr. Wilson
Speaker.P: Don dá bhliain?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. O'Toole Mr. O'Toole
Speaker.P: I rith na bliana seo, agus go deimhin postanna a tháinig ar aghaidh ón bhliain seo caite. Is í an cheist a cuireadh an bhfuil 500 post ag brath ar chinneadh an Rialtais faoi lathair. Caithim a rá nach bhfuil.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Wilson Mr. Wilson
Speaker.P: Tá an tAire ag rá mar sin más rud é gur chuir sé an t-airgead ar fáil amaireach nach mbéadh 500 postanna eile annsin ag muintir na Gaeltachta? An cheist a chuir mé ná, más rud é gur chinn an Rialtas an t-airgead a chur ar fáil atá á lorg ag na Teachtaí annseo nach mbeadh 500 postanna annsin ag teacht faoi réim Údarás na Gaeltachta?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. O'Toole Mr. O'Toole
Speaker.P: Níl sé sin fíor.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Wilson Mr. Wilson
Speaker.P: Sin é an scéal atá ag muintir na Gaeltachta.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions. Oral Answers. - Fostaíocht sna Gaeltachtaí.
MainHeading.P: 6. D'fhiafraigh

Speaker.hpid: Mr. J. O'Leary Mr. J. O'Leary
Speaker.P: d'Aire na Gaeltachta ó tharla go bhfuil an imirce ag teacht thar n-ais arís i gCiarraí, an inseoidh sé céard atá leagtha amach aige le postanna a chur ar fáil i nGaeltacht Chiarraí.

MainHeading.P: 12. D'fhiafraigh

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Flynn Mr. Flynn
Speaker.P: d'Aire na Gaeltachta céard atá leagtha amach aige le tuilleadh fostaíochta a chur ar fáil i nGaeltachtaí Chontae Mhaigh Eo.

MainHeading.P: 16. D'fhiafraigh

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Hilliard Mr. Hilliard
Speaker.P: d'Aire na Gaeltachta an bhfuil plean ar bith aige le tuilleadh tionsclaíochta a bhunú i nGaeltacht na Mí.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. O'Toole Mr. O'Toole
Speaker.P: Tógfaidh mé Ceisteanna Uimh. 6, 12 agus 16 le chéile.

MainHeading.P: Bíonn iarrachtaí leanúnacha ar siúl ag Údarás na Gaeltachta d'fhonn tionscail fhiúntacha a aimsiú a chuirfidh deiseanna fostaíochta breise ar fáil sna ceantair Ghaeltachta uile. Mar thoradh ar an obair sin meastar go raibh 4,626 dhuine fostaithe go lánaimseartha i dtionscail sa Ghaeltacht a fuair cúnamh ó Ghaeltarra Éireann/ón Údarás ar 31 Nollaig 1985 i gcomparáid le 4,405 dhuine ar 31 Nollaig 1984. Déanfar fógraíocht chuí nuair a bheidh tionscail nua le dul i mbun oibre.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: An bhfuil a fhios ag an Aire go bhfuil tográi i láthair na h-uaire i gCiarraí is i gContae Mhuigheo nach dtig leis an Údarás cinneadh a dhéanamh orthu ceal airgid agus nach féidir leo a rá le tionsclóirí áirithe ag an bpointe seo go mbeidh siad in-ann tacaíocht a thabhairt dóibh leis na postanna a theastaíonn uathu a chur ar fáil a chruthú i gceanntar Mhuigheo go mór mhór, agus mar a dúirt mé sa chéad ceist eile an n-aontódh an t-Aire nach dtig leis sin a bheith sásúil agus go bhfuil mishástacht ar chuile dhuine i ngeall ar na cúrsaí seo?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. O'Toole Mr. O'Toole
Speaker.P: Níor casadh eagraíocht orm ariamh a bhí sásta leis an méid a bhí á fháil acus. Agus an méid sin ráite agam, tá fadhbanna ag an Údarás; tá mise ag plé leo agus tá mise cinnte go dtiocfaimid ar réiteach ionnas nach gcaillfear fostaíocht ceal airgid.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: Ach nach n-aontódh an tAire nach inniu ná inné a tharla na cúrsaí seo, go bhfuil an cheist mar seo le bliain go leith nó níos mó agus nach bhfuil sé sásúil go mbeadh an tÚdarás annsin i láthair na h-uaire agus gan iad in ann a rá le tionsclaí: “Tá gach uile rud ceart ach níl an Rialtas ná Roinn na Gaeltachta sásta an t-airgead a thabhairt dúinn leis an togra seo a chur chun cinn”? An é atá i gceist nach bhfuil suim ar bith ag an Aire nó ag an Rialtas i bhfostaíocht a chur ar fáil in áit ar bith sa tír agus sa Ghaeltacht go mór mhór?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. O'Toole Mr. O'Toole
Speaker.P: Ní ghlacaim leis nach bhfuil suim agam féin ná ag an Rialtas sa Ghaeltacht ná in Údarás na Gaeltachta. Tuigim go bhfuil fadhbanna airgid ag an Údarás faoi láthair. Mar a dúirt mé cheana, tá mé tar éis bualadh le Bord an Údaráis le déanaí agus tá an cheist á scrúdú agam ag an bpointe seo.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. O'Toole Mr. O'Toole
Speaker.P: Tá i gceist anseo fostaíocht i dtrí contaethe agus chuir an Teachta Gallagher i mo leith go raibh lagú ar thoil an Rialtais agus ar thoil an Aire i leith na Gaeltachta ach má fhéachann sé ar na figiúirí, má tá dí-fhostaíocht ag dul i méid i n-áiteanna eile, tá fostaíocht ag dul i méid sa Ghaeltacht, agus níl aige ach breathnú cuir i gcás i 1985 i gContae Mhuigheo: faoi dheireadh na bliana seo caite bhí 612 post ansin agus bhí 484 ann i 1981 agus sin i rith tréimhse nuair a tharla dí-fhostaíocht an-mhór ar fud na tíre. Ná ceapadh éinne go bhfuil lagú nó cúlú ar siúl ag an Udarás ó tháinig mise anseo. Tá dul chun cinn a dhéanamh ní amháin i gContae Mhuigheo ach i gCiarraí, i nGaillimh, i dTír Chonaill agus in áiteanna eile chun fostaíocht a mhéadú agus ní thagann sé sin leis an argóint nach bhfuil suim dá laghad agamsa ná ag an Rialtas san obair atá ar siúl acu.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: An nglacfaidh an tAire leis, nuair atá dí-fhostaíocht ag dul chun cinn sa chuid eile den tír agus fostaíocht ag dul chun cinn sa Ghaeltacht, gur mar gheall ar sin gur cheart go dtabharfadh an Rialtas vóta muiníne don Udarás agus go gcuirfidís ar fáil an t-airgead atá riachtanach le go gcruthófaí na postanna atá ceadaithe. Tá géarchéim airgid san Udarás faoi láthair. An n-aontóidh an tAire go bhfuil tionsclóirí sa Ghaeltacht ag obair faoi lathair go bhfuil deontas ceadaithe dóibh ó 1985 nár íocadh an deontas leo go fóill agus gurab é an fáth leis sin ná nár thug an Rialtas dothain airgid don Údarás, deontas caipitil, leis an deontas sin a íoc?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. O'Toole Mr. O'Toole
Speaker.P: Mar a dúirt mé faoi dhó cheanna féin má fhágann an Teachta fúm é, tá mé ag rá anseo go réiteofar an cheist. Tá fadhb ann. Tá mise ag éisteacht le muinín agus le rudai maidir leis an Údarás le cúpla bliain anuas. San am chéanna tá an obair á déanamh acu, tá fostaíocht ag dul ar aghaidh agus ag ardú, agus réiteoidh mise an fhadhb.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: Ag dul ar ais ar rud a dúirt an tAire é féin tá sé iontuigthe go mbeadh ardú fostaíochta sa Ghaeltacht mar go bhfuil na structúir curtha ansin agus go mbeimís ag cur leis na structúir sin. Níl aon argóint ar bith maidir leis an rud atá ag tarlú i láthair na huaire. Táimid uilig ar aon intinn faoi na cúrsaí sin. Is ar mhaithe leis an Ghaeltacht agus muintir na Gaeltachta atáimid ag caint. An t-aontódh an tAire go bhfuil géarchéim i láthair na h-uaire, mar dúirt an Teachta Geoghegan-Quinn agus daoine eile, agus go bhfuil gá go mbeadh rud éigin á dhéanamh go luath ag an Rialtas le cúrsaí a fheabhsú maidir le fostaíocht a chur ar fáil agus tacaíocht a thabhairt don Údarás lena gcuid oibre a chur chun cinn mar ba mhaith leo.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions. Oral Answers. - Deontas do Ghaeltacht Ráth Cairn.
MainHeading.P: 7. D'fhiafraigh

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Hilliard Mr. Hilliard
Speaker.P: d'Aire na Gaeltachta maidir leis an £50,000 atá geallta do Ghaeltacht Ráth Cairn sa cháinaisnéis, an inseoidh sé cén chaoi a bhfuil sé i gceist an t-airgead sin a roinnt agus cén uair a íocfar é.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. O'Toole Mr. O'Toole
Speaker.P: Tá iarrtha ag mo Roinnse ar Chomharchumann Ráth Cairn sonraí iomlána a chur ar fáil maidir leis na tograí a bheartaítear a chur i gcrích le cabhair an airgid sin.
Nuair a gheofar an t-eolas atá iarrtha déanfar ceist íocaíochta a mheas.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: An é an rud gur shocraigh an Rialtas go dtabharfaí £500 gan rud ar bith a bheith socraithe faoin gcaoi a gcaithfí é nó cé'n socrú atá déanta leis an £500 sin a chaitheamh? An bhfuil sé ag braith ar Chomharchumann Ráth Cairn tograí a chur os comhair an Rialtais?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. O'Toole Mr. O'Toole
Speaker.P: Is é an bhun-chloch a bhí leis an íocaíocht seo an chéad lá ná go raibh féile fé leith, mar atá fhios ag an Teachta, á comoradh ag Gaeltacht Ráth Cairn anuraidh. Scríobh mise chucu ar 13 Feabhra á rá leo gurb acu-san a bhí sé sonraí tograí a chur ar fáil agus coinneáil taobh istigh den uas-pointe £500, ar ndóigh go mbeadh aontas ann faoi na moltaí seo a chur i gcrích, agus go n-íocfaí an t-airgead ar an mbonn sin. Ní dóigh liom go bhfuil aon deacrachtaí ann. Ba mhaith liom a chur i n-iúl don Teachta nach bhfuaireamar freagra ar ais go fóill, ach tá mé cinnte go bhfuil Comharchumann Ráth Cairn ag obair air.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions. Oral Answers. - Bóithre Gaeltachta.
MainHeading.P: 8. D'fhiafraigh

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Gallagher Mr. Gallagher
Speaker.P: d'Aire na Gaeltachta ó tharla drochbhail a bheith ar bhóithre Gaeltachta, an inseoidh sé céard atá leagtha amach aige leis an scéal a leigheas.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. O'Toole Mr. O'Toole
Speaker.P: Tá soláthar £200,000 ar fáil i mbliana i meastacháin mo Roinne le haghaidh bóithre áise agus portaigh sa Ghaeltacht agus tá sonraí á mbailiú ag oifigigh na Roinne i dtreo go bhféadfar bóithre den saghas sin a roghnú le caoi a chur orthu.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: An bhféadfadh an tAire a insint dúinn an bhfuil sé i gceist airgead a caitheamh ar bhóithre chontae nó go mbeadh cead ag na comhairlí chontae airgead a chaitheamh ar bhóithre Ghaeltachta taobh amuigh de bhóithre áise a fheabhsú i mbliana?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. O'Toole Mr. O'Toole
Speaker.P: Níl sé i gceist go gcaithfí aon chuid den airgead seo ar bhóithre chontae. Is é an tuairim atá agam agus ag an Roinn go mb'fhearr go bhfanfadh an fhreagracht sin ag na comhairlí chontae féin agus go gcloífí le bóithre áise maidir leis an caiteachas.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Gallagher Mr. Gallagher
Speaker.P: An n-aontódh an tAire go bhfuil clamhsán an-mhór sna Gaeltachtaí maidir le bóithre agus go bhfuil gá go mbeadh plean éigin leagtha amach le tionscail a mhealladh isteach sna Gaeltachtaí agus go gcaithfí i bhfad níos mó airgid ar bhóithre chontae, ar bhóithre móra, mar a dearfá, taobh amuigh de na bóithre áise? An bhfuil aon phlean ag an Rialtas, nó an bhfuil sé i gceist an scéal sin a bhreithniú i gcaoi go gcuirfí feabhas ar chúrsaí?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. O'Toole Mr. O'Toole
Speaker.P: Nílimse bodhar ar chor ar bith, ach ní ormsa atá an fhreagracht maidir le airgead a chur ar fáil do bhóithre chontae agus bóithre móra, mar a deir an Teachta. Sé atá dá rá agam ná go bhfuil £200,000 ar fáil agam i mbliana agus go gcloífear leis an nós imeachta a bhí ann i gcónaí maidir le bóithre áise. Ceapaim go bhfuil a lán bóithre ar fud na Gaeltachta, bóithre áise agus portaigh atá i ndrochbhail agus gur cheart cuid den airgead seo a úsáid chun feabhas a chur orthu.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: An bhfuil sé i gceist aon athrú a dhéanamh ins an tslí ina roghnófar na bóithre áise?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. O'Toole Mr. O'Toole
Speaker.P: Bhí ar intinn agam go mbeadh an réamh-obair ar fad déanta faoi dheireadh na míosa seo, ach deir comhairle chontae amháin liom nach bhfuil sé ar a gcumas meastachán agus uile a chur ar fáil do oifigigh Roinn na Gaeltachta ar an talamh, mar a dearfá. Mar sin, caithfear an rud seo a chur siar beagán, ar feadh míosa b'fhéidir, go dtí an mhí seo chugainn. Is é an fáth atá leis sin ná go mba mhaith liomsa an t-airgead seo a caitheamh chomh luath agus is féidir. Dúirt mé sa Teach seo cheana go mbeadh sé níos fearr rialacha níos dochta a leagan síos maidir le coinníollacha caiteachais den saghas seo, mar shampla, coinníollacha a bhaineann le LIS. Táim sásta é sin a dhéanamh agus b'fhéidir coinníollacha níos daingne a leagan síos.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: An bhfuil sé i gceist ag an Aire idirdhealú a dhéanamh idir bóithre áise agus bóithre phortaigh, agus céad codán áirithe a chaitheamh idir an dá chineál bóthar?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. O'Toole Mr. O'Toole
Speaker.P: Is féidir liom breathnú air sin. Tá deacrachtaí faoi leith ann toisc go bhfuil cuid de na Gaeltachtaí ina bhfuil éileamh níos mó ar bhóithre portaigh ná mar atá i nGaeltachtaí eile. Breathnóidh mé air le féachaint céard is féidir a dhéanamh faoi.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: Chomh fada agus atá an scrúdú sin á dhéanamh ag an Aire, an mbreathnódh sé ar rud amháin eile maidir le bóithre áise? Tá nós ag cuid de na comhairlí chontae meastachán an-ard a bheith acu i gcóir na hoibre ar bhóithre Ghaeltachta agus sílim nach bhfaigheann muintir na Gaeltachta lán-bhuntáiste go minic as an airgead dá bharr sin.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. O'Toole Mr. O'Toole
Speaker.P: Tá an deacracht sin ann. Caithfear meastacháin a fháil ó oifigigh cáilithe i gcomhairlí chontae agus ní féidir liomsa uisce fuar a chaitheamh ar mheastacháin den tsaghas sin agus ní maith liom a rá leo meastacháin ísle a chur isteach.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: Is féidir athrú a dhéanamh air. Cuireadh athrú ar cheana.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry if he is aware of the dissatisfaction of anglers and other associations with the fisheries restoration works on the Boyne catchment; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister of State at the Department of Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry (Mr. Donnellan) Minister of State at the Department of Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry (Mr. Donnellan)
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister of State at the Department of Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry (Mr. Donnellan)
Speaker.P: I am aware of the concern of some anglers and their associations regarding fisheries restoration works in the Boyne catchment. However, my Department have been given an undertaking by the Office of Public Works that fisheries rehabilitation of the catchment will be carried out.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. M. Cosgrave Mr. M. Cosgrave
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry if following submissions from the Irish Wild Life Federation and the Irish Wild Bird Conservancy regarding Baldoyle Estuary, Dublin, he will declare the estuary a bird sanctuary.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry (Mr. Kavanagh) Liam Kavanagh
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry (Mr. Kavanagh)
Speaker.P: I am satisfied that the coastal region between Dublin and Dundalk Bay, County Louth, is already adequately served with wildbird sanctuaries. In the circumstances I do not propose to provide for a sanctuary at Baldoyle Estuary.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. J. Leonard Mr. J. Leonard
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry if he will comment on the recent complaints regarding unregistered bed and breakfast accommodation, adversely affecting the trade of those providing registered accommodation.

Speaker.hpid: Minister of State at the Department of Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry (Mr. M. Moynihan) Minister of State at the Department of Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry (Mr. M. Moynihan)
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister of State at the Department of Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry (Mr. M. Moynihan)
Speaker.P: Concerns about unapproved accommodation have been expressed from time to time and this matter is being continually monitored by my Department. In my view, Bord Fáilte approval of tourist accommodation confers a very real competitive advantage on the premises concerned. Approved operators are, for example, eligible to avail of capital improvement grants and to participate in all the board's promotional activities. The Bord Fáilte sign of approval is a clear indication to the tourist of standards and service. Nevertheless, in the light of recent complaints I am again examining this whole question to see whether there is scope for addressing the matter under existing consumer protection legislation.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions. Oral Answers. - Sea Fisheries Policy.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Andrews Mr. D. Andrews
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry the incentives offered to attract young people to avail of the opportunity offered in the sea fisheries of Ireland; and if he will make a policy statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Donnellan Mr. Donnellan
Speaker.P: It is my policy, and that of An Bord Iascaigh Mhara, to ensure that young people who wish to take up a career in sea-fishing can avail of suitable training facilities to fit them for such a career. The board provide such facilities at their National Fisheries Training Centre, Greencastle, County Donegal, where the programme enables school leavers to train for and ultimately qualify as certified skippers.
The board's marine credit plan can also be availed of by young qualified fishermen to obtain grant and loan assistance towards the acquisition of their own boats.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry the estimated figure provided for harbour development in 1986.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry the estimated amount provided for harbour development in County Mayo for 1986, giving the harbours where it is proposed to have expenditure carried out with the appropriate sum for development in each case.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Donnellan Mr. Donnellan
Speaker.P: I propose to take Questions Nos. 23 and 39 together. The amount allocated to my Department for harbour development in 1986 is £1.8 million.

The amount allocated for harbour development in County Mayo from the Fisheries Vote for 1986 is £143,430 apportioned as follows: Killala, £26,250; Purteen, £93,750; Ballyglass, £11,250; Blacksod, £3,000 and Killerduff, £9,180.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: I congratulate the Minister of State on his post. Is he satisfied that £1.8 million will be of any consequence in the improvement of harbours this year? Can he give any indication of where these amounts will be allocated in Connacht, for example?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Donnellan Mr. Donnellan
Speaker.P: No matter how much money one would allocate to harbour development one would not cater for the number of people who want harbours extended or repaired. In my short time in the Department there has been far more work sought than would gobble up the £1.8 million. I am talking about the western seaboard. I do not have the information the Deputy has requested with regard to the western seaboard, but there is a total of £143,430 available for harbour development in County Mayo.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: Does that £143,000 odd include Roonah pier?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Donnellan Mr. Donnellan
Speaker.P: No.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: Can the Minister indicate the harbours on which the money is likely to be spent?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Donnellan Mr. Donnellan
Speaker.P: Killala £26,250, Purteen £93,750, Ballyglass £11,250, Blacksod £3,000 and Killerduff £9,180.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: Perhaps the Minister would indicate the amount available to his own County Galway in this year for harbour development?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Donnellan Mr. Donnellan
Speaker.P: I do not have that figure but I can guarantee that I am having a serious look at harbour development in the Galway area.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: How much of the £1.8 million will pay for work done last year? Are any new projects covered under the allocation? Is it the Minister's intention to undertake any new projects with the £1.8 million?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Donnellan Mr. Donnellan
Speaker.P: I do not have that information.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: Of course the Minister has it.

Speaker.hpid: An Leas-Cheann Comhairle John J. Ryan
Speaker.P: Question No. 24 from Deputy Molloy.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: Could the Minister give us an indication of any new projects?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Donnellan Mr. Donnellan
Speaker.P: I do not have that information at this time.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: The Minister had information about Killala. He does not want to give the information.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions. Oral Answers. - Rosabhil Harbour Berthage Facilities.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Molloy Mr. Molloy
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry whether provision has been made in 1986 estimates for the extension of berthage facilities at Rosabhil Harbour, County Galway; and if he will give details.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Donnellan Mr. Donnellan
Speaker.P: Pending settlement of a plan for the development of Rosabhil harbour it was not practical to make provision for the extension of berthage facilities in the harbour in the 1986 estimates. The development plan will shortly be discussed with all interested parties, thus hopefully clearing the way for an early decision on the development of this very important harbour.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: May I take it that the Minister's recent visit to Rosabhil, accompanied by senior officials of his Department, would indicate that the development plan will be available within a matter of weeks as opposed to months?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Donnellan Mr. Donnellan
Speaker.P: The Deputy could take that.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: Will the Minister be giving a particular period of time during which that plan can be discussed and reports given to the Department before any work would be undertaken?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Donnellan Mr. Donnellan
Speaker.P: I have told the people in the Rosabhil area that, as a result of a recent visit there, we intend to call the Rosabhil harbour committee together to present them with the plans for the harbour in the not too distant future.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: What I asked was how long they would have to look at the plan before they would have to report with a detailed response to the Department.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Donnellan Mr. Donnellan
Speaker.P: We would not be putting any time limit on the committee in relation to their examination of the plans.

MainHeading.P: However, if they were to spend a couple of years on that matter that would delay the development even further. My hope would be that they would look at the plans, express their opinions on them and finalise their report with a view to doing something for Rosabhil as soon as possible.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: If the development plans were returned within a reasonable period of time, would work commence this year and would money be spent by his Department in this financial year on development at Rosabhil?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Donnellan Mr. Donnellan
Speaker.P: I have a very special interest in the development of Rosabhil. There will be no unavoidable delays as far as I am concerned.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: The Minister has not answered my question. I specifically asked if any money would be spent by his Department in 1986 on development in Rosabhil.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Donnellan Mr. Donnellan
Speaker.P: As I said in my reply to Deputy Molloy's question, it would be impossible to make money available for Rosabhil in 1986 when the plans for the harbour have not been agreed.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: In other words, if the plans are agreed by the development committee and his Department well before the summer, the Minister still will not be in a position to spend any money on Rosabhil? Is that what the Minister is saying?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Donnellan Mr. Donnellan
Speaker.P: There is no need for the Deputy to be putting words into my mouth.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: I am trying to be helpful.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Donnellan Mr. Donnellan
Speaker.P: As soon as the plans for Rosabhil are agreed, I certainly would hope to act upon them.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: And spend money this year?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Donnellan Mr. Donnellan
Speaker.P: I would hope to act upon them.

Speaker.hpid: An Leas-Cheann Comhairle John J. Ryan
Speaker.P: Next question.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions. Oral Answers. - Salmon and Trout Farming.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. M. Ahern Mr. M. Ahern
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry if he has any programme for the development of salmon and trout farming; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Donnellan Mr. Donnellan
Speaker.P: An Bord Iascaigh Mhara, Údarás na Gaeltachta and the Central and Regional Fisheries Boards are actively promoting the development of salmon and trout farming in accordance with a multiannual guidance programme submitted to the EC last year by my Department. I will have a copy of this programme sent to the Deputy.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: Can the Minister give us some indication of the number of applications for salmon and trout farming now in his Department? Would he comment on the application from the Norwegians to invest in a salmon hatchery or salmon rearing station in Galway Bay, because that is linked with this whole development? What is his attitude to the Norwegian application? How many applications are held up in his Department because of lack of action in this very important area?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Donnellan Mr. Donnellan
Speaker.P: There are approximately 300 applications for licences with my Department at the moment.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: Is that apart from the Norwegian application?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Donnellan Mr. Donnellan
Speaker.P: Apart from an application from a group of Norwegians to site a tanker somewhere off the west coast. That application will be dealt with in the not too distant future.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: Could the Minister give some indication as to his attitude to that application? Is it favourable or unfavourable?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Donnellan Mr. Donnellan
Speaker.P: At this stage I would rather not pre-empt whatever decision may be made.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: I would like the Minister to indicate some interest in this area of huge potential for development. A number of applications are held up at present and applicants have not got permission to go ahead with their developement projects. Could he put some speed into the section of his Department dealing with this area and see that something worthwhile is done this year?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Donnellan Mr. Donnellan
Speaker.P: I totally reject the accusation, or personal opinions——

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: The Minister cannot reject anything. It is fact.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Donnellan Mr. Donnellan
Speaker.P: ——of Deputy Daly that I have no interest in that area.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: The Minister may reject what he likes but 300 applications are being held up.

Speaker.hpid: An Leas-Cheann Comhairle John J. Ryan
Speaker.P: A final supplementary question.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn Mrs. Geoghegan-Quinn
Speaker.P: Could the Minister indicate how many of those 300 applications are from non-nationals?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Donnellan Mr. Donnellan
Speaker.P: I could not give that information because I do not know. There are a number of applications from non-nationals. I hope that with regard to our west coast or any other part of our coast, whatever is available in riches from the seas would be available preferably to the riparian owners and those living along those coasts — preferably to nationals as against non-nationals.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Creed Mr. Creed
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry if, in view of the scarcity and difficulties in acquiring timber by processors from our forests, the steps he proposes to take to intensify afforestation which would boost employment in rural areas.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry (Mr. Kavanagh) Liam Kavanagh
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry (Mr. Kavanagh)
Speaker.P: In their plan Building on Reality the Government affirmed their determination to ensure that our national forests are developed to the maximum national advantage and that Government investment in forestry over the period of the plan would aim, inter alia, at the establishment of plantations at an annual average rate of 7,500 hectares. The current State planting programme is broadly in line with that target. In addition to the State planting programme, my Department operate two planting grant schemes aimed at encouraging the expansion of private forestry and a special publicity campaign was recently carried out to promote those schemes. I am glad to say that the response to that campaign has been quite encouraging and I am hopeful that as a result there will be a substantial increase in the level of private planting in the years ahead.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. J. Leonard Mr. J. Leonard
Speaker.P: It is fine to talk about afforestation, but it is a very serious matter to ensure that at maturity the timber will be used to the best advantage and will produce jobs. Will the Minister agree that there is great dissatisfaction among processors — and this has been the case over the years — regarding the tendering system and the practice of imposing restrictions regarding quantities and so forth? Small processors have been practically eliminated from tendering in many cases.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: The question referred to proposals to intensify afforestation and boost employment in rural areas and I think I have given a reasonable reply to that question. The points raised by the Deputy have been taken up by me since I have come into this Department. We are certainly taking action in those areas to eliminate, as far as possible, some of the difficulties which have arisen in procuring supplies for the sawmilling industry. I would have to say that the capacity in the sawmilling area vastly exceeds the amount of timber which is now available in the industry. Forests that were proceeded with during the first Coalition almost 40 years ago will come to fruition in eight or nine years time and when this timber becomes available there will be a huge increase in the amount available for the industry. The amount of timber becoming available is increasing annually but the people involved in the timber processing and sawmilling business have capacity that far exceeds the amount of timber available.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: The Minister must be aware that the planting targets have not been reached. In fact the rate of planting is in decline. Last year something in the region of 6,000 hectares were planted, whereas the objective is 10,000 hectares. Can the Minister indicate what action he proposes to enable us to fulfil the objective of planting 10,000 hectares per year? The Minister cannot say that last year's planting of 6,000 hectares was on target.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: That could be the case if the Deputy had his facts right but of course he has not. In 1984-856, 380 hectares were planted——

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: If the Deputy would listen he would get the facts and may be he would take them on board. In 1985-86 there was an increase from 6,380 hectares to 7,284 hectares. As well as that, a total of 764 hectares were planted with the assistance of private planting grants. That is an increase of about 1,600 hectares in one year, if my arithmetic is right. The figures of planting are actually going in the right direction towards the target we have set out. The Deputy should accept the figures.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: I fully accept the figures but the planting target is 10,000 hectares, of which roughly 6,000 hectares were planted last year. Can the Minister give some indication as to how he proposes to get back on target? The private afforestation is a separate matter which should be left aside for the moment.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: I do not know if the Deputy is even listening to the replies he is getting. If he listened to the figures he would see that the target is being improved very considerably each year. In 1984-85 6,380 hectares were planted while in 1985-86 7,284 hectares were planted, an increase of 900 hectares. The Deputy uses other figures because these do not suit his case.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. J. Leonard Mr. J. Leonard
Speaker.P: While we agree that there is adequate capacity, is it not true that the location of this capacity often involves the long haul of timber? Would it not be better to put more emphasis on small units which are not now grant-aided in a constituency such as my own where there are very heavy imports of pallet timber, fencing and posting which could be produced in small units, thereby creating employment where there is none at present?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: The review body on the industry met some time ago and I will be bringing forward proposals at a future date concerning the whole policy in the timber area. I have been studying it during the past month since coming into the Department and I can assure the Deputy that there will be a look at the area he is concerned about.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. E. O'Keeffe Mr. E. O'Keeffe
Speaker.P: How many hectares of those the Minister mentioned comprised cutaway forest which was replanted? I am quite sure he must have that figure.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: I have just one figure. I was not asked for that information in the question. I have given the total figure.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. E. O'Keeffe Mr. E. O'Keeffe
Speaker.P: The Minister's figures are totally misleading if he is referring to replanting.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions. Oral Answers. - County Cork Forest Fire.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. E. O'Keeffe Mr. E. O'Keeffe
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry if he will hold an inquiry into a recent fire on the Ballyhoura, Doneraile forestry belt; if he is aware from reports that the fire commenced in the morning at 10.30 a.m. and it was not extinguished, even though it was brought to the attention of his officials as it was very obviously a threat from the time it commenced; the value of forestry burned, when replanting will commence; if there will be job losses as a result; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: An inquiry by officials of my Department into the fires in question has been initiated and is continuing. Reports were received by the local forestry staff of a forest fire in the Ballyhoura area at 2.30 p.m. on 26 February 1986. Due to the difficulties of the terrain and adverse weather conditions the fire was not finally extinguished until 4.30 a.m. the following day — despite strenuous efforts of the forestry workers, fire brigades, gardaí and Army units. The fire destroyed about 300 hectares of young forest with a write-off value of £100,000. The area will be replanted as soon as possible and there will be no job losses arising from the fire.

The gardaí who are investigating the causes of the fire are following a definite line of inquiry and pending completion of their investigation I do not wish to make any further comment other than to express my appreciation and thanks to all concerned who helped in extinguishing the fires.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. E. O'Keeffe Mr. E. O'Keeffe
Speaker.P: Would the Minister agree that there was a breakdown in communication between members of his staff because of the different areas that were involved? Would he agree that the fire was seen at 10.30 in the morning preceding the blaze? Would he explain to the House why there was such a misunderstanding among the area staff?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: A small group initially tackled the fire but due to the increasing wind velocity they were unable to control the fire. The forester then implemented the major fire plan involving forestry workers, the fire brigade, the Gardaí and the Army. The efforts of those involved in fighting the fire — who numbered about 190 at one stage — were greatly hampered by the conditions, but the fire was eventually brought under control 13 hours after it was reported and totally extinguished at 4.30 a.m. I accept that initially there was an attempt to tackle the fire by a small group but when that proved not to be possible the major fire plan was brought into operation. Reports in the media of £20 million worth of timber lost and huge amounts of mature timber being destroyed were not in accordance with the facts. Only 300 hectares with a value of £100,000 were lost. The people involved, forestry workers, fire brigade, the Army and the Gardaí, showed their worth in being able to bring the fire under control and I am satisfied that everything was done to keep losses to the minimum. Compared to what was originally reported, this was a very small loss indeed.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. E. O'Keeffe Mr. E. O'Keeffe
Speaker.P: I am right in saying that the fire was noticed at 10.30 in the morning and no action was taken until late evening. I have been informed that one of the reasons is the tight budget within the Department of Forestry. The two foresters concerned were not in agreement as to who was responsible for what. Their funding will be exhausted by October if the present trend continues and that was the major reason for the fire not being extinguished and the loss of trees in the area. The Minister must be more aware of that than I am.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: My information is that the fire was reported to the forestry workers at a different hour from the one mentioned by the Deputy. He may be in possession of some facts unknown to my Department. There is an investigation currently taking place and if he has such facts his knowledge would be very useful to the Garda in investigating the causes of the fire.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions. Oral Answers. - Community Tourism Fund.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. J. O'Leary Mr. J. O'Leary
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry if he will support, at EC Council level, any initiative from the Commission to establish a Community Tourism Fund which could make a major contribution to the development of Ireland's tourism; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister of State at the Department of Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry (Mr. M. Moynihan) Minister of State at the Department of Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry (Mr. M. Moynihan)
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister of State at the Department of Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry (Mr. M. Moynihan)
Speaker.P: I would be prepared to support any initiative from the Commission which would envisage the establishment of a Community Tourism Fund. I have supported this idea in recent contacts with the EEC Commissioner for Tourism.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. J. Leonard Mr. J. Leonard
Speaker.P: Will the Minister not agree that the regulation of 12 March to encourage tourism development in depressed areas should benefit areas, such as lakeland areas which we discussed, and that it is important to pursue tourism development under that regulation?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. M. Moynihan Mr. M. Moynihan
Speaker.P: I accept that Deputy Leonard's points are very valid in relation to severely handicapped areas where tourism is a priority industry. I am pursuing intensively the proposal that an EC fund should be made available for tourism development.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. J. Leonard Mr. J. Leonard
Speaker.P: Would the Minister agree that in that directive there is a definite shift from agricultural production into other areas such as tourism, which could be used to great advantage here?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. M. Moynihan Mr. M. Moynihan
Speaker.P: I agree with the Deputy. Limited funds are already available for tourism under the Social Fund, but we really need a tourism policy within the EC with a specific tourism budget. This is my aspiration and my discussion with the commissioner for tourism will cover that.

Speaker.hpid: An Leas-Cheann Comhairle John J. Ryan
Speaker.P: We will now move on to questions nominated for priority.

MainHeading.Title: Ceisteanna—Questions. Oral Answers. - Scéimeanna do na hOileáin.
MainHeading.P: 10. D'fhiafraigh

Speaker.hpid: Mr. J. Walsh Mr. J. Walsh
Speaker.P: d'Aire na Gaeltachta an bhfuil aon staidéar déanta aige ar na scéimeanna atá réitithe ag CEE le freastal ar riachtanais daoine atá ina gcónaí ar oileáin; agus an inseoidh sé an bhfuil sé i gceist aige macasamhail na scéimeanna sin a mholadh d'Oileán Chléire.

MainHeading.P: 18. D'fhiafraigh

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: d'Aire na Gaeltachta an bhfuil sé ar eolas aige go bhfuil gá le plean cuimsitheach a chur ar fáil le gach gné de shaol eacnamaíochta na Gaeltachta a fhorbairt go hiomlán; go bhfuil deontaisí fiala le fáil ó CEE má chuirtear chuige agus an inseoidh sé má tá aon rud leagtha amach aige le tús a chur le clár oibre a bheadh riachtanach le buntáiste iomlán a bhaint as na deontaisí sin.

MainHeading.P: 47. D'fhiafraigh

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: d'Aire na Gaeltachta an bhfuil sé ar eolas aige go bhfuil muintir na n-oileán sa Ghréig agus in Albain ag fáil cabhairdheontaisí ó CEE le gach gné de shaol eacnamaíochta na n-oileán a fhorbairt agus an inseoidh sé cén fáth nach bhfuil an chabhair chéanna dhá hiarraidh do mhuintir na n-oileán Gaeltachta.

Speaker.hpid: Aire na Gaeltachta (Mr. O'Toole) Aire na Gaeltachta (Mr. O'Toole)
Speaker.P: Tógfaidh mé Ceisteanna Uimh. 10, 18 agus 47 le chéile. Tuigim go bhfuil plean d'fhorbairt na Gaeltachta á ullmhú ag Údarás na Gaeltachta ar iarratas uaimse.

MainHeading.P: Faightear cibé cabhair is féidir ar mhaithe leis an nGaeltacht ón gComhphobal i leith tograí cáilithe de chuid mo Roinne-se agus an Údaráis. Ní chiallaíonn an chabhair do na hoileáin a luaitear go bhfuil beartas ar leith ag an gComhphobal i leith oileán iontu féin. Is amhlaidh a bhaineann an clár faoina n-íoctar cúnamh le hoileáin na Gréige le tírmór na tíre sin freisin agus le tíortha eile ar an Muir Mheán. Tá cúnamh, ar dhul na cabhrach d'Inse Ghall, á fháil sa tír seo cheana féin, faoi Chlár Forbartha an Iarthair (Pacáiste an Iarthair).

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: An aontódh an tAire go ndearnadh leasú ar rialacha an Chiste Réigiúnaigh sa chaoi go bhféadfaí buntáistí faoi leith a fháil do cheantair faoi leith ar fud cheantar an EEC nuair a socraíodh é sin ar an 18 Eanáir 1984, agus tharla dá bhrí sin go raibh na Gréagaigh in ann scéimeanna faoi leith a chur isteach le buntáistí a fháil? Tharla an rud céanna in Albain gur leag siad amach scéimeanna agus tá breis is seacht milliún faighte ag Oileáin na hAlban de bharr na scéimeanna speisialta seo a chuir siad isteach le cúnamh a fháil. Agus an nglacfadh an tAire leis go bhfuil gá anois go ndéanfadh sinne réiteach den chineál céanna le buntáiste faoi leith a fháil don Ghaeltacht agus do na hoileáin Ghaeltachta go mór-mhór?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. O'Toole Mr. O'Toole
Speaker.P: Mar a dúirt mé maidir le hInse Gall agus ceist oileán na hAlban, tá an rud céanna fíor faoin tír seo maidir le Pacáiste an Iarthair, an rud ceannann céanna agus tá sé sin á dhéanamh againn anseo. Mar a dúirt mé cheana chomh maith, níl aon chóras faoi leith do na hoileáin á reachtáil faoin gCiste Réigiúnach ag an gComhphobal. Maidir leis an Muir Mheáin, sin ceist eile ar fad. Tá scéim ansin, scéim ar leith a socraíodh sa Bhruiséil i leith na Mara Meáin: tugtar IMPs orthu — Integrated Mediterranean Programme — le haghaidh forbairt an cheantair sin agus sin rud ar leith. Anois, faigheann na Gréagaigh é, ní hamháin do na hoileáin, agus tá i bhfad níos mó oileán ansin ná mar atá againne agus is cuid den mhórthír atá i gceist sna hoileáin seo agus faigheann an tír ar fad é, ní na hoileáin amháin. Ach sin rud ar leith maidir leis an Mhuir Mheáin. Faigheann na hIodálaigh chomh maith é agus anois gheobhaidh na Spáinnigh agus na Poirtingéalaigh é. Ach sin Integrated Mediterranean Programmes, sin rud faoi leith. Agus maidir le hInse Gall, tá sé sin á reachtáil againn faoi Scéim Forbartha an larthair nó faoi Phacáisté an Iarthair faoi láthair.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: An nglacfadh an tAire leis nach bhfuil aon chomórtas nó aon chomparáaid idir an tacaíocht airgid atá á fáil againne do na Gaeltachtaí agus do no hoileáin nuair a fhéachann tú ar an fhigiúr atá á chaitheamh sa Ghréig agus in Albain, agus an aontódh sé go bhfuil sé in am againne féachaint chuige go gcuirfí scéim ar leith insteach le airgead a fháil agus go mbeadh an t-airgead sin le fháil dá ndéanfaimís ár gcuid oibre i gceart? Agus, mar cheist dheiridh air sin, an nglacfadh sé leis go bhfuil plean leagtha amach ag muintir na n-oileán a leagann amach bealaí a mbeadh an chabhair sin le fáil ag na hoileáin anseo, agus an nglacfadh an tAire agus an Rialtas leis dá gcuirfí an scéim sin ar aghaidh go mbeadh buntáisti faoi leith le fáil againn ón EEC dá bharr?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. O'Toole Mr. O'Toole
Speaker.P: Tagann an tír seo in iomlán, na Sé Chontae Fichead, faoi scáth an Chiste Réigiúnaigh ó thaobh forbairt de agus sin é an chaoi a raibh sé ó thús, gur leagadh síos go mbeadh an tír ar fad ag fáil airgid ón chiste sin agus go mbeadh sé cláraithe, mar is é an moladh atá ag an Rialtas nach gcuirfí isteach ar an leagan amach sin, mar dá gcuirfí isteach air agus dá n-athrófaí é agus dá mbrisfí an contae síos i gceantair eile bheadh áiteacha eile a chaithfeadh dul dá uireasa agus ceaptar nach mbeadh sé sin ceart, agus chomh maith leis sin tá an chontúirt ann nach bhfaighimís an oiread céanna airgid ón Chiste Réigiúnch agus a fhaighimid faoi láthair don tír — tá mé ag caint faoin airgead ar fad ina iomlán.

MainHeading.P: Anois, agus an méid sin ráite agam, nuair a thagann tograí ar aghaidh gur féidir tacaíocht a thabhairt dóibh, maidir leis na hoileáin, tugtar tacaíocht dóibh, agus tá a lán samplaí. In this Mór, go deimhin, i Rinn Rua, Contae Mhaigh Eo, in Ailt an Chorráin agus in áiteanna eile ar fud na tíre sa Ghaeltacht agus sna hoileáin Ghaeltachta tá tograí a fuair airgead ón Chiste Réigiúnach tríd an Chiste Náisiúnta. Ach is é an chomhairle a cuireadh orainne go mbeadh an chontúirt ann dá n-athrófaí an scéim agus dá mbrisfí an tír seo suas i réigiúin faoi leith, nach bhfaighimís an oiread céanna airgid ón Chiste Réigiúnach. Ba mhaith liom a rá chomh maith go bhfuilimid sa tír seo ag fáil i bhfad níos mó as an Chiste Réigiúnach ná mar a bheadh tuillte againn, cuir i gcás, ar bhonn daonra nó ar bhonn méid an cheantair, cuir i gcás, mar thír. Dá n-athrófaí an scéim atá ann faoi láthair cuirfí isteach air sin. Sin é an moladh atá faighte againn agus sin é an chomhairle atá curtha orainn ag daoine go bhfuil fios a gceirde acu.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: An aontódh an tAire go bhfuil cás faoi leith ag na hoileáin agus ag cuid mhór de na ceantair Ghaeltachta agus go bhfuil go leor airgid i gceist le feabhas a chur ar chéanna, le aerstráicí a chur ar fáil agus leis na buntáistí eile a theastaíonn ó mhuintir na n-oileán a chur ar fáil dóibh? Agus an n-aontódh sé má leanaimid mar atáimid leis an chaoi a bhfuil an Ciste Réigiúnach á chaitheamh, nach mbeidh an t-airgead sin atá ansin le fáil ag na hoileáin agus ag na ceantair atá i gceist agam? An n-aontódh sé go bhféadfadh an Rialtas, ó tharla na rialacha leasaithe anois, scéimeanna a leagan amach do na hoileáin agus do na ceantair Ghaeltachta le lán-bhuntáiste a bhaint as na scéimeanna sin atá le fáil san Eoraip agus i gcaoi go gcaithfear cuid den Chiste Réigiúnach leis na feabhsúcháín seo atá curtha síos agam a chur ar fáil do mhuintir na Gaeltachta agus do muintir na n-oileán?

Speaker.hpid: Mr. O'Toole Mr. O'Toole
Speaker.P: Tá cás an-láidir le deánamh i bhforbairt na n-oileán ach á dul amú ar aon duine a deir go bhfuil ciste speisialta sa Chomhphobal le haghaidh forbairt den tsaghas seo. Níl agus tá an tuairim sin ag dul thart agus, go deimhin, chuala mé an Teachta nó chonaic mé ráiteas a thug sé ansin le déanaí agus thug sé le tuiscint go raibh ciste faoi leith ansin ach é a iarraidh. Níl sé sin fíor. Tá an ciste atá ann mar chuid den chiste iomlán a thagann chun na tíre seo le haghaidh forbairt na tíre iomlán agus is ceist pholasaí í don Rialtas é sin a athrú ach deirimse mar cheist pholasaí sé an chomhairle atá ann agus an chomhairle atá á cur orainne nach ceart dúinn cur isteach ar an gcóras atá ann faoi láthair mar tá an chontúirt ann go gcaillfí airgead dá ndéanfaí athrú anois. Má tá an Teachta agus a Pháirtí ag moladh athrú polasaí i leith an rud seo, sin ceist dóibh féin mar Pháirtí ach táimse ag rá chomh fada agus a bhaineann linne agus leis an Rialtas go bhfuilimid ag glacadh an chomhairle toisc go ndeirtear linn go bhfuil an chontúirt ann go gcaillfí airgead ón gCiste Réigiúnach dá n-athrófaí an córas.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. D. Gallagher Mr. D. Gallagher
Speaker.P: Más feidir leis na Gréagaigh agus le muintir na hAlban a gcás faoi leith a dhéanamh le haghaidh ceantar faoi leith cad chuige nach dtig linn, nach dtig leis an Rialtas cás faoi leith a dheánamh maidir le caiteachas an Chiste Réigiúnaigh sna ceantair atá i gceist agamsa ar na h-oileaín agus sna ceantair Ghaeltachta. Céard atá ag an Aire in aghaidh leagan amach den chineál sin ná ag an Rialtas? Níl aon cheist go gcaillfí airgead ar an gcaoi sin.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. O'Toole Mr. O'Toole
Speaker.P: Ní haon mhaith a bheith ag cur muide i gcomparáid le muintir na Gréige. Réitíodh cás speisialta is cosúil ar son muintir na Meán-Mhara san mBruiséal agus sin é an fáth go bhfuil airgead ag teacht ón Integrated Mediterranean Programmes atá ar bun ansin. Níl sé sin ar fáil ag ceantar ar bith eile an Chomhphobail agus ní haon mhaith bheith ag cur an dá rud i gcomparáid. Is rudaí difriúla iad. Agus maidir le muintir na hAlban mar adúirt mé cheana, tá sé sin ar siúl againn ó Phacáiste an Iarthair, agus mar a deirim níl aon rud pearsanta agamsa i gcoinne an ruda atá á rá ag an dTeachta ach is í an chomhairle atá a cur orainn ná go bhfuil contúirt ag baint leis agus dá ndéanfaimís athrú sa chóras agus dá gcaillfimís airgead dá bharr bheadh an Teachta, tá mé cinnte, ag tabhairt amach fúinn. Ní féidir leat ach comhairle a ghlacadh.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Tourism, Fisheries and Forestry if distortions of trade and competitiveness are occurring in the timber industry, resulting in job losses in sawmills by a substantial amount of timber being disposed of outside the State; the action he proposes to take to deal with the situation; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: In agreement with representatives of the Irish Timber Council I have recently set up an ad hoc committee representative of the sawmilling industry, the trade unions and the Departments concerned under an independent chairman to examine allegations about possible distortions of competition and trade in relation to the sale of timber from State forests to sawmills south and north of the Border and I have asked them to report to me within two months. Pending receipt of the committee's findings I do not wish to comment on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Daly Mr. Daly
Speaker.P: The Minister will be aware that substantial quantities of timber are being taken to places outside the State for processing while our mills are working at only half capacity. A number of sawmills closed recently, for example, the mills at Kilrush and Mountrath as well as a number in the Minister's constituency. These closures left a substantial number of people redundant. In the circumstances can the Minister provide any better answer than to tell us that another committee is to be set up? He will be aware of having received a report recently from one such committee who had sat for more than 12 months and who indicated the way in which this issue should be dealt with.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Kavanagh Mr. Kavanagh
Speaker.P: Again, the Deputy has engaged in some exaggeration. He asked first what action I was taking and when I told him what I had done in this area he was not prepared to accept that. I have set up an ad hoc committee for the purpose of ascertaining whether the problems he outlines are as he indicates. I have asked that committee to complete their work within a very short time — two months — and I trust that they will be able to conduct their investigation within that time. The committee's task is to ascertain whether there is distortion of competition and trade in relation to the sale of timber.

Under Article 34 of the Treaty of Rome which the Deputy's party accepted in the context of our accession to the EC, tenders may be accepted from nationals of other EC countries. In practice, only companies from Northern Ireland have submitted tenders to date. Regarding the other rather exaggerated claim made by the Deputy, the total sales of timber to Northern Ireland in the past three years have been as follows: 1983, 8 per cent; 1984, 8.5 per cent and 1985, 9.6 per cent. The matter should be put in perspective and not distorted.

Speaker.hpid: An Leas-Cheann Comhairle John J. Ryan
Speaker.P: Seanad Éireann has passed the Social Welfare Bill, 1986.

Speaker.hpid: The Taoiseach Garret FitzGerald
Speaker.P: It is proposed to take Nos. 2, 19 and 5. Private Members' Business will be No. 67.

Speaker.hpid: An Leas-Cheann Comhairle John J. Ryan

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Hyland Mr. Hyland
Speaker.P: The other reason given was lack of ministerial responsibility. Surely no one here could question the matter of the area of ministerial responsibility in relation to the operation of prisons.

Speaker.hpid: An Leas-Cheann Comhairle John J. Ryan
Speaker.P: The Deputy must not question the Chair's right to disallow the question.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Hyland Mr. Hyland
Speaker.P: I have no wish to enter into conflict with the Chair but I submit that the matter concerned is of an urgent nature, that there is ministerial responsibility in relation to it and that consequently this House should have an opportunity to debate the issue.

Speaker.hpid: An Leas-Cheann Comhairle John J. Ryan

Speaker.P: I wish to raise this issue on the Adjournment.

Speaker.hpid: An Leas-Cheann Comhairle John J. Ryan
Speaker.P: The Chair will communicate with the Deputy.

Speaker.P: I wish to raise on the Adjournment the matter of the contents of my private notice question which related to the impasse in the teachers' pay dispute and to the possibility of appointing a mediator. The question was disallowed.

Speaker.P: The Chair will communicate with the Deputy.

Speaker.P: Because of the unsatisfactory nature of the reply given by the Minister for the Gaeltacht to Question No. 5 I wish to raise on the Adjournment the subject matter of that question.

Speaker.P: The Chair will communicate with the Deputy.

Speaker.P: I wish to raise on the Adjournment the matter of the shortage of staff at Malin Head radio station, a situation that has arisen because of Government cutbacks.

Speaker.hpid: An Leas-Cheann Comhairle John J. Ryan
Speaker.P: The Chair will communicate with the Deputy.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Gene Fitzgerald Mr. Gene Fitzgerald
Speaker.P: I wish to ask the Taoiseach, now that the free port legislation has been enacted, when it is proposed to make the necessary regulations to enable the establishment of the Cork Free Port.

Speaker.hpid: The Taoiseach Garret FitzGerald
Speaker.P: I will inquire about that and I will communicate with the Deputy.

Speaker.hpid: An Leas-Cheann Comhairle John J. Ryan
Speaker.P: It does not arise on the Order of Business.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Gene Fitzgerald Mr. Gene Fitzgerald
Speaker.P: The legislation was recently passed by the House. I beg to differ with you, a Leas-Cheann Comhairle. It does arise and, furthermore, no progress has been made after two years.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. O'Rourke Mrs. O'Rourke
Speaker.P: The Taoiseach did not reply to my question. Does the Taoiseach consider that this matter is urgent enough——

Speaker.hpid: An Leas-Cheann Comhairle John J. Ryan
Speaker.P: The Chair has indicated to Deputy O'Rourke the reasons why her question was disallowed.
